Sync and edit files on two iPhones


November 23, 2013  sync-iphones  by

Need to sync a file between two iPhones and edit it on both? Hereâ€™s what you need:

  • PlainText installed on both phones
  • Two Dropbox accounts (free will do!)

Itâ€™s a little tricky to get going once installed, so hereâ€™s what I did:

  1. Share a folder between both accounts. Donâ€™t share an individual file.
  2. When linking your Dropbox account, choose Link to Entire Dropbox.
  3. Create a file in the shared folder, and edit away!

That should really be it. Your file should now be synced on each phone after you edit it, and you wonâ€™t lose it since itâ€™s in Dropbox! Hereâ€™s a screenshot of PlainText in action:

Some great things about this setup:

  • Itâ€™s free.
  • Itâ€™s simple!
  • Conflicts cause a copy of the file to be saved, so theyâ€™re not lost.
